name: 'Mystery with Hermit Foil' - Electric Free Time Machine
description:
'MYSTERY WITH HERMIT FOIL'

Debut album from Electric Free Time Machine

"Takes you on a ride through a rich and diverse landscape. If you have an ounce of musical integrity go and buy this"

- the lunecy review 

Full review here:
www.tinyurl.com/n8tmlf 

Greyboard Digipack with embossed detail / 4-page colour inlay

supplied shrinkwrapped and barcoded









Tracks: 

1.Blue Box

2.Heroin Pie

3.30 Days

4.Optimus Prime

5.Bite the Hand that Feeds the Arm

6.Big Think

7.Dog in the Wood

8.W.Y.M.P.H

9.Seratonin

10.Onion

11.Meet Your Eyes

12.For Free

13.Teethmarks

Running time: 42 minutes

Recorded and mixed at the George Martin Studio, LIPA by Hugh Mckenna and Josh Millican

Mastered by Tony Draper

"Electric Free Time Machine From deepest Lancashire quote Frank Zappa, Captain Beefheart and Tom Waits (among others) as their influences. From hard and fast psychedelic punk boneyard blues and vast experimental krautrock ambient strangeness, to abrasive shambolic metal and delicate acoustic folk. Each setlist is constantly different, relying on both carefully structured tracks and the completely improvised. We have been fortunate to play with bands such as Sam and the Plants, Gnod, Arficeden, Hot Bone, Jeniferever, Bilge Pump and as Sound carriers for Damo Suzuki



Printed by breed-media - fsc approved carbon neutral pressing
